revised_title: Molecular Structure and Absorbance of Blue-Sensitive Rod Visual Pigment in the Conger Eel
tldr: The study examines the molecular structure and absorbance spectra of the blue-sensitive rod visual pigment in the conger eel. The researchers cloned and sequenced the opsin cDNA, finding it highly homologous to the form of opsin expressed in deep-living European eels. The study provides evidence that specific amino acid sites are involved in the spectral tuning of blue-sensitive visual pigments.
